meanings.definition: State a fact or belief confidently and forcefully.
meanings.sent1: She was asserting her opinion during the debate.
meanings.sent2: He always asserts his authority in the office.
meanings.sent3: The cat was asserting its dominance over the other pets.
meanings.sent4: The waves were asserting their power against the shore.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was asserting the importance of studying for the exam.

meanings.sent1: The witness was asserting the truth in court.
meanings.sent2: I assert that the project will be completed on time.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was asserting his love for ice cream.
meanings.sent4: The sun was asserting its presence in the sky.
meanings.sent5: She was asserting her commitment to the cause.
